content: I'm trying to apply https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-19977 in UTG. It's the first time going through the process and I'm hitting some blockers, although the documentation until this point is pretty excellent. I've managed to get on the Create a Proposal until point 13. The related proposal ticket is https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-293. Where can I find the "Draft Proposal"-tab? How do I move the ticket out of its current state?
Also I'm not sure how to interpret this page for adjusting the version of the CodeSystem: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Documented+Execution+of+UTG+Versioning

Hi @Alexander Zautke . Did you request submitter permissions from the form linked on https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VMAH/Vocabulary+Maintenance+at+HL7 yet? If you haven't done that then the option will not appear.

I also noticed that your ticket is a 'Pro Forma' ticket but based on the proposed changes I believe it should be a 'Change Request'. I don't want you to get too far and have to recreate the ticket due to this. You can always withdraw/abandon the ticket but you will need to wait until you have the correct Jira permissions.

I am waiting for input from @Grahame Grieve since he set the initial versions for the FHIR content in THO, but by UTG policy the version should be incremented to 1.0.0 because adding a concept is a major change.

Hi @Jessica Bota I was able to submit the proposal so I thought that my account had sufficient rights, as documented here: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91995465#GetAccesstoJiraUTGProposalProject-NotsureifyouhavepermissionstobeaSubmitter?

Happy to go though the process if needed
I don't follow why it would not be a "Pro Forma" ticket as FHIR-I has already voted on the issue?
You can create a ticket without the proper permissions, but you won't have the right options, like 'draft a proposal'.

Jessica Bota said:

I am waiting for input from Grahame Grieve since he set the initial versions for the FHIR content in THO, but by UTG policy the version should be incremented to 1.0.0 because adding a concept is a major change.

That's clear, thanks

FHIR-I sponsored the proposal and approved it in that regard, but it still needs the community to vote. Pro Forma is meant to be used to fix technical errors with the content, or if it was approved via a ballot process, and isn't to be used for suggested changes to vocabulary objects.
I've submitted an application to become a submitter
Great! It isn't an instant thing, but please follow up if you do not receive an email that your permissions are updated sometime tomorrow.

Jessica Bota said:

FHIR-I sponsored the proposal and approved it in that regard, but it still needs the community to vote. Pro Forma is meant to be used to fix technical errors with the content, or if it was approved via a ballot process, and isn't to be used for suggested changes to vocabulary objects.

Ah ok! Will change the type accordingly, thanks.
Shouldn't 'submitter' be available to everyone who's an HL7 trusted user?
Need Jira programming to make that happen; the UTG role permissions work differently than the regular Jira user types.
@Jessica Bota So far I haven't received any e-mail from JIRA or see any new functionality after logging in. Could you double-check that the new role has been assigned? Thanks for your help!
Hi @Alexander Zautke. We've been having some trouble getting the submitter/reviewer requests consistently sent to me for some reason. I've added you in as a submitter now so you should be good to go.

@Alexander Zautke sorry for the late reply. We checked and it looks like you have the correct permissions.

(Oops, just saw Marc's reply above. Thanks Marc!)

Thanks for all the help so far. I've now submitted the changes. Am I, as the author of the changes, now responsible to find enough voters in order for the proposal to pass? Or this this managed differently?
@Alexander Zautke Yes, encouraging people to review and vote on your proposal is typically something that you will need to do.

Just want to make sure for UP-293: @Jessica Bota we want it to be a change request instead of pro forma, right? Also, does the fact the ticket was resolved over a year before the code system was migrated to THO impact that at all? Don't know if we have an answer in terms of policies to the second question.

Assuming that we do need a change request ticket instead of a pro forma ticket @Alexander Zautke will need to make a new ticket as a change request. Once that's done I can handle the rest since I've got the branch that's ready to go to consensus review sitting on my local machine.

Chatted with Jess and she agreed that we do want it to be a change request ticket. @**Alexander Zautke|193430 It's actually just as quick for me to make the ticket and copy the details over so I'll handle that. Which means the new ticket will be in consensus review very shortly.
Ups, sorry. Forgot about that. Someone mentioned it here in the thread. Thanks!
I found one more ticket that was voted on by FHIR-I. Will create a change request for that soon.

The new ticket is UP-299 and it is now in consensus review. You'll need someone from the OSGVoters-FHIR group, the OSGVoters-Intl group and the OSGVoters-Voc group as well as needing 15 votes in total. (but each voter from an OSG group currently counts for 2 votes.)
